Instruction: Combine soaked peas and water in a pot and bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover, and let simmer for about 2 hours, or until tender.
Bring the peas to a boil in the soaking water. Lower the heat and let them simmer until they become very soft, stirring occasionally, for about 1 1/2 hours, adding water as necessary.
Stir in butter, salt, sugar, and parsley into the peas. For a thicker consistency, incorporate flour and cook while stirring until thickened, about 5 minutes.

This dish pairs wonderfully with pork. I enjoy serving it during the holiday season to enhance the presentation. When accompanied by lingonberries (or cranberries) alongside the pork, it creates a beautiful and festive Christmas appearance.
